title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify any ecological benefit provided by forests (other than providing habitat), such as any the following:

· Absorbs carbon dioxide/produces oxygen (gas exchange)

· Maintains ecological and/or species diversity

· Provides food for organisms

· Moderates/regulates (local) climate

· Purifies/filters water or air

· Reduces soil erosion

· Absorbs/stores/regulates water

· Helps maintain stream temperature/stream flow

· Aids in nutrient cycling

· Aids in soil formation

The response identifies one ecological benefit provided by forests (other than providing habitat), such as one the following:

· Absorbs carbon dioxide/produces oxygen (gas exchange)

· Maintains ecological and/or species diversity

· Provides food for organisms

· Moderates/regulates (local) climate

· Purifies/filters water or air

· Reduces soil erosion

· Absorbs/stores/regulates water

· Helps maintain stream temperature/stream flow

· Aids in nutrient cycling

· Aids in soil formation

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify an economic benefit provided by forests, such as any of the following:

· Source of forest products (timber, medicine, nuts, crops such as shade-grown coffee, etc.)

· Tourism

· Jobs in recreation/tourism/forestry

· Reduces health care costs (through a reduction in air pollutants)

· Improves crop yields (through a reduction in air pollutants)

The response identifies one economic benefit provided by forests, such as one of the following:

· Source of forest products (timber, medicine, nuts, crops such as shade-grown coffee, etc.)

· Tourism

· Jobs in recreation/tourism/forestry

· Reduces health care costs (through a reduction in air pollutants)

· Improves crop yields (through a reduction in air pollutants)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe any environmental consequences, other than those related to the loss of boreal forest habitat, that result from the extraction of bitumen or the transportation of synthetic oil to customers, such as any of the following:

· Release of greenhouse gases/air pollutants such as NO X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGobGaae4ta8aadaWgaaWcbaWdbiaabIfaa8aabeaaaaa@38EE@ from fossil fuel combustion that powers equipment/transportation/oil processing

· Release of air pollutants ( NO X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGobGaae4ta8aadaWgaaWcbaWdbiaabIfaa8aabeaaaaa@38EE@ , SO X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGtbGaae4ta8aadaWgaaWcbaWdbiaabIfaa8aabeaaaaa@38F3@ , or particulates) during mining operations or oil processing

· Storage and disposal of large amounts of solid/liquid mining waste, which can be toxic to organisms

· Pollution of surface water and/or groundwater from oil spills/leaks during transport

· Sediment pollution in surface water and/or groundwater from strip mining

· Disturbance from pipelines, such as habitat fragmentation, disruption of migratory routes, etc.

· Noise pollution from use of machinery during processing or transport

· Diversion/use of water from surface water and/or groundwater for processing oil

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the final answer.
descriptions: The response meets none of the criteria below.
The response meets one of the criteria below.
The response meets both of the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the final answer.

NOTE: If the student did not correctly calculate part (d), the response for part (e) can earn points if the incorrect values were used correctly in the equations in part (e).

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the final answer.

NOTE: If the student did not correctly calculate part (d) and/or part (e), the response for part (f) can earn points if the incorrect values were used correctly in the equations in part (f).
